name: Sazzat Sohel
review_text:
Visiting the Peace Pagoda in Darjeeling was a truly serene experience. Nestled on a hilltop, the pagoda offers stunning panoramic views of the surrounding mountains and the town below. The peaceful atmosphere, coupled with the sound of gentle prayers and the sight of the golden Buddha statue, creates a sense of tranquility. The architecture is beautiful, and the surrounding gardens are well-maintained, providing a perfect spot for quiet reflection. It's a great place to escape the hustle and bustle of the city and find inner peace amidst natures beauty. Highly recommended for those seeking a calm and spiritual retreat.

name: Raghava Velagaleti
review_text:
Peace Pagoda is a Buddhist monument constructed as a symbol of peace, unity, and harmony. These structures, often built by Buddhist communities and organizations, hold profound spiritual, cultural, and social significance. Peace Pagodas are dedicated to fostering a global culture of peace. They remind humanity of the need to resolve conflicts through understanding and nonviolence, reflecting the core teachings of Buddhism.

name: Aditi Jaiswal
review_text:
I visited the Japanese Temple or Peace Pagoda in Darjeeling and really enjoyed it. The temple is a beautiful white structure with great views of the surrounding mountains, including the Kanchenjunga range.

At the top, theres a statue of Buddha and a display that tells the story of his life. The temple is a peaceful and serene spot, and its definitely worth a visit if youre in Darjeeling

name: Shobit Chakraborty
review_text:
The Japanese Peace Pagoda in Darjeeling is a stunning monument that promotes peace and harmony. Located on the slopes of the Jalapahar Hill, it offers breathtaking views of the snow-capped Kanchenjunga range 1.

This beautiful pagoda was built under the guidance of Nichidatsu Fujii, a Buddhist monk from Japan, and took 36 months to complete 1. It stands 28.5 meters tall and has a diameter of 23 meters, making it a prominent landmark in Darjeeling 1.

The Peace Pagoda houses four gold-polished statues of Buddha, representing different stages of his life 2. The walls of the temple also feature eight sandstone carvings that depict stories from Buddhas life.

The Japanese Peace Pagoda is a must-visit attraction in Darjeeling, promoting peace, harmony, and stunning views of the Himalayas.
Visited on
Weekday

name: Rajkumar Das
review_text:
The Peace Pagoda in Darjeeling is a majestic monument to peace, harmony, and unity. Perched atop a hill, this stunning structure offers panoramic views of the Himalayas and a tranquil atmosphere.

Pros:

1. Breathtaking views of Kanchenjunga and the Himalayas
2. Serene and peaceful atmosphere
3. Impressive architecture and beautiful gardens
4. Significant Buddhist heritage site
5. Easy accessibility

Cons:

1. Steep climb for those with mobility issues
2. Limited parking

Tips and Insights:

1. Visit early morning or late afternoon for best views
2. Wear comfortable shoes for climbing
3. Respectful attire recommended
4. Explore nearby Japanese Temple and monastery

Rating Breakdown:

- Ambiance: 5/5
- Views: 5/5
- Architecture: 5/5
- Historical Significance: 5/5
- Overall Experience: 5/5

Recommendation:

The Peace Pagoda is a must-visit destination in Darjeeling. Unwind in its serene surroundings, marvel at the stunning vistas, and immerse yourself in the regions rich cultural heritage.

name: Shayan Sen
review_text:
The **Peace Pagoda** in Darjeeling is a truly serene and spiritual experience. Nestled atop the slopes of the famous **Shrubbery Hills**, this beautiful structure offers not only a peaceful atmosphere but also panoramic views of Darjeeling and the surrounding mountains, including a stunning glimpse of the mighty Kanchenjunga.

The pagoda itself is a magnificent piece of architecture, with its pristine white walls and intricate carvings depicting various scenes from the life of the Buddha. As I walked around the pagoda, the tranquil ambiance was palpable, and the sound of chimes added to the overall sense of calm. The surrounding gardens are well-maintained, providing a perfect spot for reflection or simply enjoying the natural beauty of the area.

What made the experience even more special was the opportunity to learn about the significance of the Peace Pagoda, which was built to promote peace and harmony. It was both a spiritual and cultural journey, and I was moved by the message of peace that the place embodies.

Accessible by a short drive or a peaceful hike from Darjeeling town, the Peace Pagoda is a must-visit for anyone in the area. Whether youre seeking spiritual solace, a place of quiet contemplation, or simply want to take in some of the best views of Darjeeling, this spot is a true gem. Highly recommended!
Visited on
Weekday

review_text:
Too crowed during day time, with everyone just taking picture.
First day I visited in day and I didnt like it much, spoke to one gentleman who was cleaning and he told me about pooja. So attended pooja the next morning.

Right time to visit this temple is between 4.30 - 5.30am during morning puja, you will be welcomed in puja and you can chant with everyone if u wish to, its beautiful and peaceful vibe. One will definitely enjoy the pooja and all efforts of going that early will be worth it.
highly recommend.

name: Usman Gani
review_text:
Darjeeling, often called the Queen of the Hills, is a picturesque hill station in West Bengal, India, known for its stunning views of the Himalayas, lush tea gardens, and rich cultural heritage. The town sits at an elevation of 6,700 feet, offering a cool and refreshing climate, which attracts tourists year-round. Its iconic attractions include the Darjeeling Himalayan Railway (a UNESCO World Heritage Site), where the narrow-gauge "Toy Train" winds through misty hills and valleys--a delightful experience for travelers of all ages.

One of Darjeeling's most beautiful sights is the sunrise view from Tiger Hill. As the first rays of dawn hit the snow-capped peaks of Kanchenjunga, the third-highest mountain in the world, visitors witness an unforgettable panorama. Darjeeling is also known for its tea, and a tour through one of its tea estates provides a peek into the intricate process of tea-making, along with a chance to taste some of the world's finest teas.

The town offers a mix of adventure, spirituality, and history. There are monasteries like the Ghoom Monastery, which add a sense of tranquility and are a must-visit for their spiritual ambiance and beautiful artwork. Nature enthusiasts can trek through nearby trails, while shopping lovers can explore the bustling Mall Road, known for its vibrant Tibetan handicrafts, woolen wear, and souvenirs.

Darjeeling's charm lies not only in its natural beauty but also in its friendly people, diverse culture, and unique flavors. With a variety of Tibetan, Nepali, Bengali, and local cuisines to explore, food lovers can indulge in local momos, thukpa, and some of the best tea in the world.

name: Manish Kumar
review_text:
Peace Pagoda in Darjeeling is a serene and spiritually uplifting destination, embodying tranquillity and harmony. Located on the slopes of the beautiful town, it offers panoramic views of the surrounding hills and the Kanchenjunga range, especially stunning on clear days.

Built under the guidance of Japanese Buddhist monk Nichidatsu Fujii, it symbolises peace and unity across different cultures.

The white structure, adorned with golden statues of Buddha, is a sight to behold. Ideal for meditation and reflection, the pagoda provides a peaceful retreat from the bustling town.

name: Chaudhary Saaab
review_text:
The Peace Pagoda in Darjeeling is a tranquil and serene destination, offering breathtaking panoramic views of the surrounding hills and the Kanchenjunga range. Built by the Japanese Buddhist Nipponzan Myohoji order, the pagoda stands as a symbol of harmony and peace. Its white structure contrasts beautifully against the lush green landscape, creating a peaceful ambiance perfect for meditation or quiet reflection. Visitors can experience a sense of calm while walking around the pagoda and admiring the intricate carvings of Buddhas life events. Its a must-visit for those seeking solace amidst nature.

name: Rumman Hossain
review_text:
At Peace Pagoda, Darjeeling

Visiting the Peace Pagoda in Darjeeling was an incredibly serene and surreal experience. The calm atmosphere, paired with the cool mountain breeze, created a perfect escape from the everyday chaos.

What made the experience even more magical was the weather. The cold, misty air and clouds drifting through the towering pine trees gave the whole place an otherworldly feel, as if I had stepped into a peaceful, dreamlike realm. The sight of the clouds touching the trees and the peaceful quiet of the surroundings made it a perfect place for reflection and meditation.

The pagoda itself is beautifully constructed, with stunning views of Darjeeling's hills and valleys. Its a symbol of peace and unity, and standing there felt deeply spiritual and calming. The environment is impeccably maintained, and the peacefulness of the place adds to its charm.

If youre looking for a tranquil and scenic spot in Darjeeling, the Peace Pagoda is a must-visit. It offers both natural beauty and a profound sense of serenity.

Weekday

name: Roy Manab
review_text:
A tranquil haven, nestled in natures embrace,
Where gentle breezes whisper secrets, and worries erase.
A place of stillness, where the heart can unwind,
And the soul can breathe deeply, leaving fears behind.

Soft sunlight filters through the trees above,
Casting dappled shadows, a soothing labor of love.
The scent of blooms and fresh earth fills the air,
Inviting you to relax, without a single care.

In this serene oasis, time stands still,
As the worlds din and chaos, slowly start to chill.
Your mind quiets, your spirit starts to soar,
In this peaceful haven, youll find what youve been looking for.

I hope these lines transport you to a serene place, where you can find peace and tranquility!
You should visit .

name: Dev Maru
review_text:
Absolutely serene atmosphere! Went there in mid July as against general opinion! But loved it.

The route is from the Darjeeling station to all the way up via Mall Road! Going there in rains is pure joy! It rained every like 5 minutes for a minute or so. The flora there is absolutely stunning in this season! The greenery and the aged trees welcome you like an old Monk. No words or pics can justify the experience!

name: SAIF
review_text:
Nice place but unnecessarily crowded with chapris.
Visiting the Japanese Peace Pagoda in Darjeeling during the monsoon season is a mesmerizing experience that blends tranquility with the lush, rain-soaked beauty of the Himalayas. This serene and spiritual site, built under the guidance of Nichidatsu Fujii, stands as a symbol of peace and unity, and the monsoon only enhances its ethereal charm.As you approach the Pagoda, the mist and gentle rain create an almost mystical atmosphere. The lush greenery surrounding the area comes alive, with vibrant hues and fresh foliage adding to the beauty of the site. The sound of raindrops softly hitting the leaves and the distant hum of the monsoon winds make the experience meditative and calming.The white structure of the Peace Pagoda stands in stark contrast to the verdant surroundings, making it even more striking. The intricate carvings and golden statues of Buddha gleam subtly through the soft monsoon light, offering a sense of reverence and peace. Walking up the steps, the cool, moist air rejuvenates you, and the view from the top is breathtaking, despite the occasional cloud cover. On clear moments, you get glimpses of the surrounding mountains shrouded in mist, adding to the surreal beauty.The monsoon season also means fewer tourists, allowing for a more intimate and reflective visit. The calm and quiet of the place during this time is ideal for meditation and introspection. The nearby prayer room offers a sheltered spot where you can sit quietly, listen to the rhythmic sound of the rain, and absorb the peaceful vibrations of the site.The Japanese Peace Pagoda in Darjeeling during the monsoon is not just a visit but an experience that touches your soul. The combination of natural beauty, spiritual ambiance, and the soothing effect of the monsoon makes it a must-visit. Whether you are seeking peace, inspiration, or simply a beautiful spot to enjoy the rain, this place provides it all. Highly recommended for a serene and soulful retreat.
Visited on
Weekday

name: nihal
review_text:
I recently visited the Peace Pagoda in Darjeeling, and it was such a peaceful and beautiful experience! The pagoda is located on a hill, and the views from the top are absolutely stunning. You can see the Kanchenjunga mountain range on clear days, which is breathtaking.

The pagoda itself is a beautiful white structure with intricate carvings and golden statues of Buddha. The atmosphere is very serene, and you can hear the gentle sound of prayers and chanting, which adds to the tranquility of the place.

One of the things I loved the most was the sense of calm and peace that you feel as soon as you enter the area. It's a great place to sit and meditate or just relax and take in the beauty around you. The surrounding gardens are also very well-maintained and add to the overall charm of the place.

The entry is free, and it's a must-visit if you're in Darjeeling. Whether you're interested in history, architecture, or just looking for a peaceful spot to unwind, the Peace Pagoda has something for everyone

name: Sathyam Hitler
review_text:
On the edge of the hillside at the end of AJC Bose Rd, stand a gleaming white pagoda which is one of more than 70 pagodas built around the world under the supervision of Buddhist Monk, Nichidatsu Fujii or popularly known as Fujii Guruji who was also the founder of Japanese Buddhist Nipponzan Myohoji organization. Japanese peace Pagoda and Japanese Temple is one of most famous place in Darjeeling West Bengal. Named aptly as Peace Pagoda, the tranquility of the place can hardly be expressed in words. Japanese peace pagoda is a revered place which is believed to be the symbol of spirituality and peace.

The foundation for Japanese Peace Pagoda was laid down by Fuji himself, on 3rd November 1972. However, this Pagoda was inaugurated after his death, in 1992, by his senior most disciples. Fujii Guruji was immensely inspired by Mahatma Gandhi. Distressed by the Hiroshima Nagasaki bomb drop Fujii Guruji decided to promote non-violence and peace throughout the world and started constructing Peace Pagoda or Shanti Stupa as shrines for world peace.

There are four iridescent, gold-polished statues of Buddha and adorned on the peace pagoda walls with eight sandstone carvings, narrating stories of different stages of Gautama Buddhas life. Visitor can get a 360deg panoramic view of the Darjeeling and Mt. Kanchenjunga on a clear day from Peace Pagoda making Japanese Peace Pagoda an ideal pictorial place and after viewing the magnificent sight you can get the feeling of inner peace in Japanese Temple Nestled in the vicinity to the pagoda. Prayer hour in the Japanese Temple are from 4:30 am - 6 am and same time at the evening. If you visit during the prayer hour you get a chance to see the praying ritual and get included yourself, is not it a great way of learning another culture. Getting here involves a pleasant, gentle 30 minutes walk from Clubside junction along Gandhi and AJC Bose Road, past the curiously named Institute of Astroparticle Physics and Space Science.

Scenic view with a calm environment amidst the nature, its a treat for both eye and soul. Japanese peace pagoda or the peace monument has always been the sign of brotherhood and harmony and one can spend hours listening to the low humming of monk chanting in the temple leaving the visitor with a sense of serenity. The tranquility at the Peace Pagoda in Darjeeling should be experienced to be believed! 
Visited on
Weekday

Wait time
No wait

Reservation recommended
Not sure

name: Alapan Ghosh
review_text:
This is one the most beautiful monument that you will find around the town of Darjeeling. This pagoda style has been copied from other monuments in odisha and Sarnath as well. This pagoda is present on the way of Tiger Hill and you can visit this place while coming back from watching sunrise in tiger hill. This pagoda was in remembrance of India japan bilateral ties and was established by a Buddhist monk from Japan. The environment here is serene and peaceful. You will enjoy your time here and the place has a calming presence on your mind. It will calm your senses and the natural beauty of outside will make your mind lighter and peaceful. The chirping of birds and the statue of lord Buddha and his lifestory has been carved in the walls of the pagoda that will actually let you know a lot about Buddhism. A must visit place for religious people and people looking for some peace and tranquility. Highly recommended for the travel enthusiasts as well.

name: Khagendra Prasad
review_text:
The Peace Pagoda in Darjeeling is a serene and iconic landmark that promotes harmony and tranquility. Built under the guidance of Nichidatsu Fujii, a Japanese Buddhist monk, it features impressive murals depicting various stages of Buddhas life. Visitors can enjoy panoramic views of the Himalayas from the pagodas location. Additionally, there is parking available for both cars and bikes, making it convenient for travelers.

name: Animesh Choudhury
review_text:
Nestled atop the picturesque hills of Darjeeling, the Peace Pagoda stands as a beacon of tranquility and spiritual serenity. This iconic monument, also known as the Japanese Peace Pagoda, is a symbol of peace and harmony, inviting visitors from around the world to experience its profound beauty and spiritual ambiance.

Constructed under the guidance of the revered Buddhist monk Nichidatsu Fujii, the Peace Pagoda is one of the many similar structures built across the globe with the aim of promoting world peace. Its striking white facade, adorned with intricate carvings and golden embellishments, is a testament to the exquisite craftsmanship and dedication of its creators.

Upon entering the pagoda grounds, visitors are greeted by lush gardens and panoramic vistas of the surrounding hills and valleys. The serene atmosphere and the gentle sound of prayer flags fluttering in the breeze create a sense of calm and introspection.

Inside the pagoda, visitors can explore the intricately decorated prayer halls adorned with murals depicting the life of Buddha and scenes of enlightenment. The ambiance is conducive to meditation and quiet contemplation, allowing visitors to immerse themselves in a sense of spiritual renewal and inner peace.

The highlight of a visit to the Peace Pagoda is undoubtedly the breathtaking views it offers of the Himalayan mountain range, including the majestic peaks of Kanchenjunga. Whether bathed in the golden light of sunrise or the soft hues of sunset, the panoramic vistas from the pagoda are truly mesmerizing, offering a glimpse of natures grandeur and inspiring a sense of awe and reverence.

In conclusion, the Peace Pagoda in Darjeeling is not only a remarkable architectural marvel but also a sanctuary of peace and spirituality. Its tranquil ambiance, stunning vistas, and profound message of universal harmony make it a must-visit destination for travelers seeking solace and inspiration amidst the beauty of the Himalayas.

name: pradeep kumar k
review_text:
Finding parking and reaching the Peace Pagoda is a fortunate occurrence, and once you arrive at the temple, you will be transported to a different world. It is undeniably one of the most extraordinary places to visit in Darjeeling. The Peace Pagoda serves as a stunning tourist attraction, emanating a serene ambiance. Intricate sculptures depicting various phases of Lord Buddhas life adorn the premises. The site is meticulously maintained, with cleanliness and parking facilities available. To reach the Peace Pagoda, one must ascend a flight of stairs, and on a clear day, you can behold a breathtaking view of the majestic Kanchenjunga. The Japanese Temple is also located within the same compound, serving as the initial point of interest upon entering the premises.

name: Faruk Kadir
review_text:
Peace Pagoda in Darjeeling is a must-visit for anyone seeking tranquility and stunning views. Located atop a hill, this beautiful structure offers a serene environment perfect for meditation and reflection. The pagoda itself is an architectural marvel, adorned with intricate carvings and golden statues of Buddha, representing different stages of his life.

The surrounding gardens are meticulously maintained, adding to the overall sense of peace and calm. From the top, visitors are treated to breathtaking panoramic views of Darjeeling and the majestic Himalayas, making it an ideal spot for photography.

The staff and monks are welcoming and respectful, providing insight into the history and significance of the pagoda. Whether youre a spiritual seeker or simply looking for a peaceful retreat, Peace Pagoda in Darjeeling is an unforgettable experience. Highly recommended for its beauty, serenity, and the sense of calm it imparts to all who visit.

name: Binindita Das
review_text:
The Peace Pagoda in Darjeeling is a prominent landmark and a symbol of peace and harmony. Its one of the 80 such pagodas worldwide built under the guidance of Nichidatsu Fujii, a Japanese Buddhist monk and peace activist.

Located on the slopes of Jalapahar Hill in Darjeeling, the Peace Pagoda offers breathtaking views of the surrounding mountains and the town below. The pagoda itself is an architectural marvel, with its gleaming white structure and traditional Japanese design elements.

The primary purpose of the Peace Pagoda is to promote world peace and interfaith harmony. Visitors can experience a sense of tranquility while walking around the pagoda and enjoying the peaceful surroundings. Inside the pagoda, there are exquisite murals depicting scenes from the life of Gautama Buddha.

The Peace Pagoda in Darjeeling attracts tourists and pilgrims alike, offering a place for meditation, reflection, and an appreciation of Buddhist teachings on non-violence and compassion. Its also a great spot for panoramic photography, especially during sunrise or sunset.

name: Samagata Reekth
review_text:
Most serene and peaceful place in the busy city of Darjeeling. You can reach the place by car, or can take scenic route by foot ,from near Darjeeling railway station, along the road adjoining Columbas Church. The place around the Buddhist temple is scenic and beautiful, and is peaceful. Frequented by tourists as well as locals, this place is one of the must see visit ,on a trip to Darjeeling.

A japanese temple is also at the same place.
Please give a visit to gain some peace ands spend some quality time .
Avoid taking your own vehicle ,as road are too narrow.

name: Harish Singh Shekhawat
review_text:
Visiting the Japanese Temple and Peace Pagoda in Darjeeling would be a perfect fit for me if Im seeking a tranquil escape amidst natural beauty. The serene atmosphere of the temple and the profound symbolism of the pagoda would resonate with my appreciation for spirituality and peaceful environments. Plus, the stunning views from the Peace Pagoda would offer me a moment of reflection and connection with nature, aligning perfectly with my desire for meaningful experiences.

name: Dr. Geetali Saha
review_text:
Surrounding by the impressive Pine trees, each tree representing a century or more of standing out there, its indeed a wonderful peaceful place. With a stand for circumambulation at three levels of the huge structure, the ambience becomes more soothing. There are four figures of Lord Buddha located on each direction and all four represent various poses. The serene environment brings out your inner peace. A very well maintained place of worship with basic amenities including parking available.

name: Gobinda Debnath
review_text:
This temple is dedicated to Lord Buddha and his life journey is beautifully carved here. .................

This place is visited by every tourist visiting Darjeeling as it is one of the main places among the 7 spots in the city. ..........

Located on the top of the hill, this place offers a very wonderful view of the city and the Kanchenjunga Hills. ..............

There is also a Japanese temple inside the temple campus and sitting here for a while gives you an inner peace.
Visited on
Weekend

Wait time
No wait

Reservation recommended
Not sure

name: Paras Jhanji
review_text:
Peace Pagoda is one of the most beautiful tourist spot in Darjeeling. Its a serene place to visit. Different phases of Lord Buddhas life is sculpted here.

This place is very neat and clean, well maintained, parking facility is there. For Peace Pagoda, you have to go upstairs. You can get wonderful view of Kanchenjunga if weather is clear.

Japanese Temple is also situated in the same compound. This place will come first after entering into the premises.

The Peace Pagoda in Darjeeling is a serene Buddhist stupa, inaugurated in 1992. Situated on the slopes of Jalapahar Hill, a few kilometres from the town of Darjeeling.
Visited on
Weekend

No wait

name: Kumar Pallav Singh
review_text:
Peace Pagoda is a Buddhist stupa situated on the slopes of the Jalapahar hill in Darjeeling.

The pagoda was built by a Japanese monk. Its a serene place to visit.

Japanese Temple is also situated in the same compound.

The calm atmosphere here will enchant you. From here the Kanchanjangha view (if the weather is clear then only) is just mind blowing.

Its one of the sightseeing point of Darjeeling.

This place is very neat and clean, well maintained, parking facility is there.

I really recommend this place to visit. One can be much pleased when he visits this place. This place fills ones mind with profound tranquility.

review_text:
Peace Pagoda is a Buddhist stupa situated on the slopes of the Jalapahar hill in Darjeeling. The pagoda was built by a Japanese monk. It is not only a famous tourist spot in Darjeeling but also a symbol of peace. This place is well maintained, well decorated & neat and clean. The calm atmosphere here will enchant you. From here the Kanchanjangha view (if the weather is clear then only) is just mind blowing.

review_text:
This place has two attractions. One is at the entrance itself where there is a two storey structure in which there is a Buddhist temple in the first floor. The second one is the marvellous Buddha statue about a certain distance into this place. This big Buddha statue is flanked by carvings depicting milestones in Buddha's life on all sides. A must watch in Darjeeling.

name: Asish Kumar Mohanty
review_text:
To reach the pagoda, visitors need to walk from the main gate along a narrow road that goes downhill and uphill. 2. Visitors can join the prayer ceremonies held from 4:30 a.m. to 6 a.m. and 4:30 p.m. to 6:30 p.m.

Located in the Jalapahar hill, the Japanese Temple is built in traditional Japanese style where you can join the prayers and feel the spiritual peace amongst humming and chants. Close to it is the Peace Pagoda where there are four large avatars of Lord Buddha.

At a distance of 2.5 km from Darjeeling Himalayan Railway, Darjeeling Peace Pagoda is a Buddhist stupa situated on the slopes of the Jalapahar hill in Darjeeling.

name: Sudipto Das
review_text:
This place is to be experienced before noon, that is in the 1st half. During that time, the Pagoda receives direct sunlight which makes it extremely beautiful. Perfect for taking photos.

Only problem is the road leading to the parking place is very narrow; due to sudden rush during peak period all the cars got struck in the middle of the road. We had to walk half a kilometers leaving the vehicle. The toilet facility is horrible! Neither it is cleaned, nor there was any water available.

Authorities must look into these matters to make it a better experience for the tourists.

Weekday

name: Dhiman Mukherjee
review_text:
The Japanese Peace Pagoda in Darjeeling is a profound symbol of tranquility and universal harmony. Situated on the slopes of the Jalapahar Hill, this architectural marvel not only graces the landscape but also carries with it a spiritual aura that captivates visitors.

Upon reaching the Peace Pagoda, the first impression is one of serenity. The gleaming white structure against the backdrop of the lush green hills creates a stark yet harmonious contrast. The pagoda, built by the Japanese Buddhist monk Nichidatsu Fujii, is part of a global mission to promote peace and non-violence.

As you ascend towards the pagoda, a gentle hush seems to settle in, inviting contemplation and reflection. The panoramic views from the pagodas vantage point are breathtaking, offering a sweeping panorama of Darjeeling town, the Himalayan peaks, and the sprawling valleys below.

The intricate reliefs and statues that adorn the Peace Pagoda depict scenes from the life of Buddha, conveying a message of compassion and enlightenment. The meticulously maintained gardens surrounding the pagoda add to its ethereal beauty, providing a peaceful space for meditation or a leisurely stroll.

One cant help but be moved by the spiritual ambiance within the pagoda. Whether youre seeking solace, exploring Buddhist philosophy, or simply marveling at the architecture, the Japanese Peace Pagoda in Darjeeling stands as a poignant reminder of the enduring quest for peace in our tumultuous world. Its a must-visit destination for those in search of both inner and outer tranquility.
Visited on
Public holiday

name: Dr. HareKrishna Mandal
review_text:
It is located in Darjeeling. A Peace Pagoda is a Buddhist stupa designed to promote world peace and harmony. These structures often feature traditional Buddhist architecture and are found in various locations around the world. The first Peace Pagoda was built by Japanese Buddhist monk Nichidatsu Fujii in 1952 in Hiroshima, Japan. Peace Pagodas have since been constructed in different countries, including India, Nepal, and the United Kingdom. They serve as symbols of peace, non-violence, and unity among people of different cultures and backgrounds.

name: Mayank Abhishek
review_text:
One of the best places to visit in Darjeeling. The pagoda was built by a Japanese monk. The pagoda has the entire story of Gautam Buddha from his childhood to Nirvana to post his demise. Beautiful place, peaceful vibes and great view of Kanchenjunga from here.
The stupa can be reached by foot from Mall road in 30 mins uphill walk or taking a taxi/cab.

name: Amartya Ghosal
review_text:
One of the Peace Pagodas in India, this temple complex was constructed under the guidance of Nichidatsu Fujii and stands as a major tourist attraction in Darjeeling. Surrounded by a mystical rhododendron forest on one side and situated adjacent to the Japanese Temple, this location offers peace, tranquility, and serenity.

Make sure to include it in your Darjeeling sightseeing itinerary. Typically, taxi or cab drivers incorporate it into the 7 points or 5 points sightseeing tour.

name: Debmalya Pramanik
review_text:
Enjoy the Peace Pagoda and the Buddhist Temple at Darjeeling. We visited in the evening when there was almost vacant! The place has some amazing views to enjoy, but we were unlucky due to cloudy weather.

The peace pagoda was initiated by Fuji Guruji after he witnessed the bombing at Hiroshima & Nagasaki and was inaugurated on 1972. The beautiful place has depicted the life of Gautam Buddha through some amazing sculptures.

The place is well maintained, and the Buddhist Temple is well decorated.

name: SARBENDRA NATH BERA
review_text:
The Peace Pagoda in Darjeeling is a serene Buddhist stupa, inaugurated in 1992. Situated on the slopes of Jalapahar Hill, a few kilometres from the town of Darjeeling. From the top of the Pagoda visitors can get a panoramic view of Darjeeling landscape including the Kanchenjunga range. The serene ambiance and the proximity to nature made it a truly memorable visit.

I visited that place from toy train railway station to by foot tracking through the way locals & monks go there.
On my way there was great nature scene and local people house, hotels and shops.
A long way there was greenry with sitting arrangements.
Great place... indeed.

name: Vivek Kumar
review_text:
The foundation stone of the pagoda was laid on 3 November 1972 by Nichidatsu Fujii, and was inaugurated on 1 November 1992. The pagoda was designed by M. Ohka, and it took 36 months to construct. It houses the four avatars of Buddha including Maitreya Buddha. The height of the pagoda is 28.5 metres (94 ft) and diameter is 23 metres (75 ft).The Pagoda is situated on the slopes of the Jalapahar hills, in the town of Darjeeling.

name: Nur-E Qadar (Tisha)
review_text:
Peace Pagoda Temple is a Japanese Buddhist temple situated in the middle of dense forests of Darjeeling. It houses the different incarnations of Buddha. It has a golden color statue of Gautama Buddha inside it. One can pay a visit to this sacred shrine throughout the year. People of all faiths visit Peace Pagoda frequently. Moreover, no one is bounded to attend the prayers. One can exit from the prayer hall whenever he/she likes.

There are no charges for clicking photos but making videos of the main prayer hall is entirely prohibited.

name: Subham Karmakar
review_text:
The Peace Pagoda in Darjeeling is a prominent Buddhist monument known for its spiritual significance and stunning views of the surrounding landscape. Heres more information about it:

Name: Peace Pagoda, Darjeeling

Location: The Peace Pagoda is situated on the slopes of the Jalapahar Hill in Darjeeling, West Bengal, India.

History: The Peace Pagoda was built under the guidance of Nichidatsu Fujii, a Japanese Buddhist monk and peace activist. It is one of the many peace pagodas he initiated around the world with the aim of promoting world peace and harmony.

Purpose: The Peace Pagoda stands as a symbol of peace, compassion, and non-violence. Its a place of worship, meditation, and reflection for people of various backgrounds and beliefs.

Architecture: The pagoda features a distinctive design with a pristine white exterior and a gold-colored dome. Its architecture is inspired by Japanese styles and reflects simplicity, symmetry, and harmony. The pagoda usually has tiers representing different aspects of Buddhist teachings.

Visiting: The Peace Pagoda is a popular tourist destination and can be reached by walking from Darjeeling town or by taking a taxi. The journey to the pagoda might involve some uphill walking, but the panoramic views along the way are rewarding.

Views: One of the main attractions of the Peace Pagoda is the breathtaking panoramic view it offers. Visitors can enjoy stunning vistas of the Himalayan mountain range, Darjeeling town, and the surrounding valleys.

Cultural Significance: The Peace Pagoda is not only a place of religious significance but also a symbol of unity and understanding among different cultures and faiths. It serves as a reminder of the importance of working towards global peace and harmony.

Activities: Apart from the spiritual aspect, visitors often engage in meditation, quiet contemplation, and enjoying the serene atmosphere. The pagodas location amidst nature makes it a perfect spot for relaxation.

name: Shubham Namasudra
review_text:
The Peace Pagoda is a white octagonal structure with a golden dome. It is surrounded by gardens and offers stunning views of the surrounding mountains, including Kanchenjunga. The Peace Pagoda is a popular tourist destination and is a symbol of peace and hope. There is also a Japanese Temple near it. However you have to leave your shoes outside before entering.

The Peace Pagoda is a great place to learn about Buddhism and to experience peace and tranquility. If you are visiting Darjeeling, be sure to add the Peace Pagoda to your itinerary.

name: Tareq Salahuddin
review_text:
Saturday 24th June 2023 - Japanese Temple and Peace Pagoda are one of the tourist attractions in Darjeeling. There are very few people who have not visited these two places while visiting Darjeeling. As usual I also went to see these signs.
It was really nice to visit this very nice place. But the problem is, the thick cloud seemed to follow me to take a selfie at that time. The result was - far from seeing the whole place properly, it was not possible to capture enough pictures and videos.
As much as I could, I shared with you.
Darjeelings Peace Pagoda or Peace Stupa was established to unite people of all races and religions of the world and spread the message of world peace. Like many other peace stupas, it was built under the supervision of Nichidatsu Fujii (1885-1985), a Japanese Buddhist monk and founder of the Nipponzan-Myohoji sect.
Its foundation stone was laid on 3 November 1972 by Nichidatsu Fuji. It was inaugurated on 1 November 1992. The design of Shanti Stupa was drawn by M. ohh Its height is 28.5 meters (94 ft) and diameter is 23 meters (75 ft).

name: Aheli Barik
review_text:
Darjeeling Peace Pagoda is located in the town of Darjeeling,West Bengal. Peace Pagodas, also known as Shanti Stupas, are Buddhist monuments built to inspire peace. The stupas, which are accessible to people of all races and backgrounds, were founded by Japanese monk Nichidatsu Fujii, who was profoundly influenced by Mahatma Gandhis commitment to nonviolence.

review_text:
I think this place is usually called World Peace Pagoda, established by the Nichiren Sect of Japanese Buddhists.

I stayed at a temple established by the same people in Sarnath (near Varanasi, India), so it was nice to cycle up here and see the sunrise, spent some time there, I wanted to talk to the monks but they were doing a fast and meditating, so better not to disturb.

name: Nupur Sur
review_text:
Peace Pagoda in Darjeeling is a mesmerizing destination that offers a perfect blend of serenity and spirituality & breathtaking panoramic views of the surrounding landscapes. All tour operators keep this point on 7point list. You have to reach early otherwise your car will leave you little far from there. It houses the four avatars of Buddha. The pagoda also features a beautiful garden with clouds and fogs. No charges to entry.The white architecture is covered with Lush green beautiful background of dense pine forests overlooking the valley.

name: Siddharth Nanda
review_text:
A very beautiful serene and tranquil place in Darjeeling. After a short climb to a hill top one reaches the base of the pagoda. It's massive building which one needs to climb to reach the top. At the entry there is a prayer hall where chanting goes on. Absolutely peaceful place. The trees here are extremely old and very very tall I haven't seen such tall trees anywhere in India that you can compare by seeing the height of the trees by the building on the photos. Must visit place and please spend time there to enjoy nature's beauty.

name: Himani Mewada
review_text:
Title: Peace Pagoda in Darjeeling is a mesmerizing destination that offers a perfect blend of serenity and spirituality. The gleaming white stupa stands tall on the hilltop, offering breathtaking panoramic views of the surrounding landscapes.

The atmosphere at Peace Pagoda is incredibly tranquil, making it an ideal spot for meditation and contemplation. As I walked around the pagoda, I felt a profound sense of peace and harmony.

The intricate carvings and the golden Buddha statue inside the pagoda are awe-inspiring. Additionally, the surrounding gardens and well-maintained surroundings add to the overall beauty of the place.

Visiting Peace Pagoda was a spiritually enriching experience, and I would highly recommend it to anyone seeking solace and a deeper connection with themselves and nature. Its an essential stop for those exploring the cultural and spiritual facets of Darjeeling.

name: Som Bose
review_text:
In addition to seeing new places, we travel to escape our hectic lives and find tranquilly. Every visitor should put a stop at this temple in Jalapahar during the prayer period on their itinerary. It is the type of encounter that frequently sparks an individual quest. The Peace Pagoda, which displays Lord Buddhas four incarnations, is next to the temple. You can see the whole Darjeeling region, including the Kanchenjunga range, from the top of the pagoda.
The Japanese Buddhist Sangha of the Nipponzan Myohoji school of Buddhism owns this temple. This sects adherents recite the short phrase Nam-Myoho-Renge-Kyo in order to contemplate the core of Buddhism and awaken the Buddha within. Locally referred to as the Japanese Temple, the buildings straightforward design emphasises the sects emphasis on substance over ornament. Your voice will naturally become a whisper in the prayer room due to how serene it is. The chanting of Nam-Myoho-Renge-Kyo echo across the foggy surrounding hills during the hour of prayer. A strong desire for everlasting peace permeates the prayer as it floats into the mountains and penetrates into every crack.

Location: 13 km from Sterling Darjeeling

Timing: 4:30 am to 7 pm daily

Prayer Hours: 4:30 am to 6 am, 4:30 pm to 6:30 pm

Weekday

name: Adil Khan
review_text:
Peace Pagoda, also known as the Japanese Temple is a famous tourist attraction of Darjeeling located close to the Mall road with a short drive.
It has a free entry not requiring any tickets.
You might have to walk uphill for a little while depending upon the traffic at the time.
The main entrance has a small flight of stairs leading to the Japanese Temple with a stone tablet in front mentioning details about the place.
Flower beds are scattered around the temple.
On the right of the stairs the road leads to the Peace Pagoda which is the main attraction here.
It is a photogenic site for most tourists and also has a good view of the surrounding valley.
A low platform of sorts is built where many sit and rest.
About 20-30mins maximum is required to properly look at everything at this location since it doesnt have much to offer but is a heritage site and a tourist attraction none the less.

P.S. washrooms are available at the car parking zone.
Visited on
Weekday

name: PRANABESH SEN
review_text:
The Japanese temple and Peace Pagoda in Darjeeling, India is a popular tourist attraction that draws visitors from all over the world. The temple was built in 1972 by Nichidatsu Fujii, a Buddhist monk and peace activist from Japan, with the aim of promoting world peace and harmony.

The Peace Pagoda is located adjacent to the temple and is a large, white structure that features multiple tiers and is adorned with various symbols and teachings related to Buddhism. It was built in 1992 to commemorate the birth centenary of Mahatma Gandhi, the father of the Indian nation.

The Peace Pagoda is a symbol of peace and non-violence

name: Dinesh
review_text:
Tranquility and Spiritual Bliss:
The Peace Pagoda in Darjeeling is a serene haven that offers a respite from the bustling city. This magnificent structure stands as a symbol of peace and unity, exuding a tranquil ambiance that captivates visitors. The pagodas architectural beauty and breathtaking views of the surrounding Himalayan ranges make it a must-visit destination. The meticulously maintained gardens and the opportunity for meditation and reflection further enhance the spiritual experience. While some additional information about the history and significance of the pagoda would be valuable, its tranquil atmosphere and awe-inspiring vistas make the Peace Pagoda an enchanting place to visit.

name: Sagar Rock
review_text:
Japanese Peace Pagoda is one of the most popular attractions in the Darjeeling city of West Bengal. It is one of those Peace Pagodas (Buddhist stupas) in the world that have been established with the aim of creating a special niche for enlightening people from all religions, creeds and origins, to come together and work for world peace. It was build under the supervision of a Buddhist Monk, Nichidatsu Fujii, who was also the founder and preceptor of Nipponzan Myohoji, a Buddhist order for word peace.

The foundation stone of the Japanese Peace Pagoda in Darjeeling was laid down by Fujii himself, on 3rd November 1972. However, this Pagoda was inaugurated after his death, in 1992, by his senior most disciples. Nichidatsu Fujii, popularly known as Fujii Guruji, was also a close associate of Mahatma Gandhi. Perturbed by the tragedy that followed the dropping of atom bombs in Hiroshima and Nagasaki, in 1945, Nichidatsu Fujii pledged to teach the world the importance of non-violence, goodwill and harmony.

review_text: One of the best place for me for Darjeeling trip. Ive come Darjeeling twice and come here also twice. This place is silence and peace. Its one of my favourite place in Darjeeling.

name: bunty mullick
review_text:
The Peace Pagoda in Darjeeling was built under the guidance of the Japanese Buddhist monk Nichidatsu Fujii. It was inaugurated in 1992 and serves as a symbol of peace and harmony. The pagoda is a white structure with golden accents, and it offers panoramic views of the surrounding mountains and the town of Darjeeling.

The Peace Pagoda is a place of worship and meditation, attracting both locals and tourists. It is known for its serene atmosphere and the beautiful views it provides. Visitors can walk around the pagoda, enjoy the peaceful surroundings, and even participate in Buddhist ceremonies if they wish.

name: Shikha Thapa
review_text: A peaceful and clean place to be.

name: yogesh singh
review_text:
It is a very peaceful place and its part of the Darjeeling day tour.
We visited this place in the afternoon and there was not much rush here.. we peacefully enjoyed our time. Here you will find four different avatars of buddha.
There is a beautiful monastery nearby.
You have to walk for a few mins to reach here as they have narrow roads and often lead to jam on weekends.

name: A P
review_text: Time 4.30 am to 7 Japanese temple with Pagoda.Temple Lama requested us to chant with small drums pad.

name: Rishin Ghosh
review_text: A popular tourist spot with a hint of Japanese culture. You can get a glimpse of Darjeeling town from here.

name: jack rollins
review_text: Heaven on the Earth

name: Payal Chhetri
review_text: Peaceful place

review_text: Nice place to visit.

review_text: Good experience

review_text: Very peaceful place...

review_text: Peaceful and must visit in Darjeeling

name: Probir Kasba
review_text: Peaceful...nature beauty

name: Kuntal ROY
review_text: The foundation stone of the pagoda was laid on 3 November 1972 by Nichidatsu Fujii, and was inaugurated on 1 November 1992. The pagoda was designed by M. Ohka, and it took 36 months for constructing it. It houses the four avatars of Buddha including Maitreya Buddha.

name: Suman Sharma Biswas
review_text: Calm and soothing environment.

name: Dulha Mia
review_text: The most peaceful place in Darjeeling. Amazing architectural structure with Buddhists touch. Surrounded by pine trees. Must visit place in Darjeeling. Here you can find peace of mind. Very beautiful and calm place.

name: Arun Kumar Tharikatte
review_text:
The place was neatly maintained and due to the Mist it looked fantastic !!!


It was clean and there were not many crowds too.

name: veera raju
review_text: Worst maintenance of traffic and toilets are horrible .There is no parking and heavy congestion

name: Krishna Rai
review_text:
Great place .

Clean , peace

name: Subhankar Das
review_text:
Location: in Darjeeling

Attraction: it is one of the most beautiful tourist attractions. Kanchanjungha view and beautiful Japanese temple.

Parking: enough parking space is available, however if you visit late during the daytime, there will be high traffic, best time to visit is early in the morning.

Entry fee: nil

Toilets: available but not clean

View: in winter or in a clear sky situation, you will get one of the best view of Kanchanjungha and adjoining peaks.

Tips: if you are taking own vehicle / two wheeler, you will have to be very careful about using Google Map. There are many roads that lead to no road or army roads. So, normal vehicles are not allowed there.
Use local guidance or ask traffic police for directions.

This place is very peaceful, please maintain silence not to destroy the charm of this temple.

name: Rajiv ailawadi
review_text: Peace reflects from every part of the temple. Positive vibes.

name: kumardeep kar
review_text: Quite calm and peaceful place.

name: Deepak Mishra
review_text: Peaceful & Relaxing place

name: Saheli Nath
review_text: Nothing special.. can visit

name: Vishal Saket
review_text: Nice peace monument and views

name: subham sinha
review_text: Peaceful place

name: Aditya Dhali
review_text: This is a Japanese temple. One should visit once.

name: Aditya Pati
review_text: Great place with great views of the Kangchenjunga

name: Stephen Fernandes
review_text:
The drive to the Pagoda is very nice, though Google gave us the wrong route. The parking for the Pagoda is a bit chaotic. Once you pass that initial stress of parking the place is really beautiful and very well maintained.

The place is very peaceful and has beautiful gardens. The flowers growing around the Pagoda just add so much more to the place.

Overall a beautiful place away from the hustle bustle of the city.

name: Aman gupta
review_text:
Its a very peaceful place

But the journey of reaching this place might get hectic due to traffic,so plan your journey bit early

name: Genesis
review_text: Awesome scenic beauty. Calm and serene atmosphere. On your left (Upper side) there is green view and on the other side (lower side) you will find the local residences, If the day is cloudy you can observe clouds moving, floating as extra eye-catching sight seeing over the tree from here without any cost.

review_text: Darjeeling is paradise. One of the most beautiful hill stations one can see.

review_text: Peaceful place.

review_text: nice

review_text: Simply awesome

review_text: A wonderful white marble pagoda of Buddhist people. Its actually a Japanese pagoda. Its located on higher altitude of Darjeeling. Its a very quiet place with a wonderful scenic view from top of the mountain.

name: Abhi Abhishek
review_text: Nice place and you will get some peace and will able to connect with nature.

review_text: Nice place

review_text: Veri beautiful place

name: Sciencer Ali
review_text: Good place

name: Rahul
review_text: The name supports the vicinity PEACE. This is a beautiful and peaceful place to visit, with stunning architecture and serene surroundings. The pagoda offers a place for meditation and reflection, and the views from the hilltop location are breathtaking. The atmosphere is tranquil and calming, making it a perfect escape from the hustle and bustle of everyday life. Overall, it is a must-visit destination for those seeking peace and spirituality.

name: Bunty Singh
review_text: Peace pagoda is lit. Even on rainy days. Note to go upto top of big building you need to remove shoes way outside. On rainy days i recommend just taking a photo from far. Love from Toronto Canada

name: Alind Khare
review_text: Amazing View From Hills.

name: Abhishek Dutta
review_text: Good place

name: Prakash Singh
review_text: I love this place

name: BIRAG MESSI10
review_text: A peaceful place just like the name. Wonderful place, stunning view. A good place for clicking photos.

name: Varsha
review_text: Very beautiful and calm. We went there just before closing time at night, so couldnt experience the view from there. Make sure u arent exhausted when u visit there, otherwise u couldnt fully experience this place.

name: SAYANTANI GHOSH
review_text: Very nice quote place .

name: Pranav Y
review_text:
Godd place

Very peaceful

name: ABHISEK DUTTA
review_text: Jpanese Peace Pagoda in Darjeeling and was absolutely captivated by the peaceful and serene atmosphere of the location. The monastery was nestled in the foothills of the Himalayas, and the views of the surrounding mountains were absolutely breathtaking.

name: Ramu Jharpla
review_text: Feel good place...call.n clean ...something different

name: Anakin Skywalker
review_text: Quiet and peaceful place away from city noises.

name: Kavya Rao
review_text:
Japanese temple and peace pagoda are the places to visit if you happen to visit Darjeeling.

It was a new experience for me when I entered the Japanese temple. Two ladies were rhymtically beating the drums along with chanting some prayer.

They give us smaller versions of banging thing to go along with them. We can sit, bang that, and pray along with them. It was so peaceful and calm. I think one can sit for hours together to pray.

Peace pagoda was a different place altogether. The statues of Buddha from his birth to his meditation, all are available to see. Nice greenery maintained. We get to see nice views of the city from here.

name: Nivedita Das
review_text: Place full of beautiful scenic beauty as well as a very peaceful ambience. To my opinion, its a must-visit place in Darjeeling.

name: Samir Sarkar
review_text: Here you will find true peace. Your eyes will be dazzled by the beautiful scenery all around. If the sky is clear, you can enjoy the beautiful view of Kanchenjunga.

name: PRASHANT DUNDAGEKAR

name: Arunav Ray
review_text:
The Peace Pagoda in Darjeeling is a beautiful and unique destination that is worth a visit for anyone exploring the city. Set atop a hill, the pagoda is a stunning structure that exudes peace and tranquility, making it an ideal place for meditation and spiritual reflection.

One of the standout features of the Peace Pagoda is the breathtaking view it offers of the surrounding landscape. From the top of the hill, you can enjoy a panoramic view of the majestic Himalayas and the lush greenery that surrounds the city. It is an unforgettable sight that will stay with you long after you leave.

The pagoda itself is a remarkable piece of architecture, with intricate carvings and designs that reflect Buddhist culture and heritage. It is a place of worship, and visitors are encouraged to respect the spiritual significance of the site. The pagoda also features a beautiful garden that is perfect for a leisurely stroll or quiet contemplation.

One unique feature of the Peace Pagoda is the daily prayer ceremony that takes place at certain times of the day. The chanting of the Buddhist monks and the ringing of the bells create a serene and peaceful atmosphere that is both calming and uplifting. The prayer timings may vary, so its advisable to check the timings before visiting.

Overall, the Peace Pagoda in Darjeeling is a must-visit destination for anyone seeking inner peace and tranquility. Its a serene and picturesque place that offers a unique experience to visitors. With its breathtaking views, beautiful architecture, and daily prayer ceremonies, the Peace Pagoda is a unique attraction that should not be missed.

name: MotoHolic Sergey
review_text:
The Peace Pagoda in Darjeeling is a truly stunning and peaceful place to visit. The tranquility and serene atmosphere are truly enjoyable. However, the presence of loud tourists who are only interested in taking selfies can disrupt the peaceful atmosphere.

Despite this, the peaceful atmosphere of the place can still be felt. The various depictions of Buddha and the intricate relief work are a sight to behold.

Do not forget to visit the Japanese temple near the Pagoda. The prayer time is especially mesmerizing and amazing to experience. The prayers are held twice a day, from 4:30am to 6:00am and from 4:30pm to 6:30pm. Make sure to plan your visit accordingly.

Visitors should be mindful and respectful of the peaceful nature of the place. It is a place to reflect and meditate, not just for taking selfies. By being mindful of others and the serene atmosphere, visitors can truly appreciate the beauty and tranquility of the Peace Pagoda.

Safe travels

name: Ravi Shankar Dayal
review_text:
The Peace Pagoda in Darjeeling, India, is a magnificent Buddhist structure that serves as a symbol of peace and harmony in the region. The pagoda is a popular tourist attraction and a significant spiritual center for Buddhists.

The Peace Pagoda was built by the Japanese Buddhist monk, Nichidatsu Fujii, in the 1970s as part of his mission to promote peace and non-violence around the world. The pagoda is one of several built by Nichidatsu Fujii in different parts of the world, all with the same message of peace and harmony.

The pagoda is situated on a hilltop and offers stunning views of the surrounding mountains and valleys. Visitors must climb a flight of stairs to reach the pagoda, but the effort is well worth it for the breathtaking views.

The structure of the pagoda itself is impressive, with its white marble exterior and golden spire. Inside the pagoda, visitors can see beautiful murals depicting the life of Buddha and other important Buddhist figures.

One of the most notable aspects of the Peace Pagoda is the sense of tranquility and serenity that it exudes. Visitors can meditate or simply enjoy the peaceful surroundings, making it a popular spot for those seeking a respite from the hustle and bustle of daily life.

Overall, the Peace Pagoda in Darjeeling is a must-visit destination for anyone interested in Buddhism or seeking a peaceful and serene environment. Its stunning beauty and powerful message of peace and harmony make it a truly special place.

name: Ayanabha Trivedi
review_text: Probably the most iconic structure at Darjeeling, its pure white glows among the green of tall pines on one side and the vast span of valleys on the other side. A picturesque place that deserves a place on the list.

name: Gangaram Sapkota
review_text:
At a distance of 2.5 km from Darjeeling Himalayan Railway, Darjeeling Peace Pagoda is a Buddhist stupa situated on the slopes of the Jalapahar hill in Darjeeling. It is very captivating and serene.
It is one of more than 70 pagodas built around the world by the Japanese Buddhist Nipponzan Myohoji organization and among the most popular attractions in Darjeeling.

The foundation stone of the pagoda was laid in 1972 by Nichidatsu Fuji, a Buddhist monk from Japan and founder of the Nipponzan-Myohoji Buddhist Order. Inaugurated in 1992, the pagoda was designed by M. Ohka. Being the tallest structure in Darjeeling with a height of 28.5 meters, it is open to people of all faith and is purposely made to propagate peace and prosperity in the world.

Peace Pagoda houses four shining and gold-polished statues of Buddha. Also, the walls of the temple have eight sandstone carvings which depict different stories from the different stages of Gautama Buddhas life. Known for its tranquility, Peace Pagoda offers breathtaking view of snowy peaks along with the mighty Kanchenjunga.

There is also a fabulous Buddhist Temple adjacent to peace pagoda. Also known as Nipponzan Myohoji Buddhist Temple, this is a two storied white building built in a traditional Japanese style. There is picture of the founder Fuji Guruji and a model of Buddha. During daily prayers, people will get a chance to feel divine peace.

Nipponzan Myohoji Buddhist Temple
Situated 10 km from the main town. Japanese style two storeyed building. We can see the avatar of lord Budha.
Fujii Guruji who is also the founder and preceptor of Nipponzan Myohoji who saw the tragedy of the atom bomb in Hiroshima and Nagasaki established this temple.
From 4:30 am to 6:00 am in the morning and again from 4:30 pm to 6:30 pm in the evening are the prayer timing. We can join the prayer. A huge drum Ho-Ko is beaten and we can vibe along the rhythm with a small drumming pad and stick given.

name: Keshav Mahajan
review_text:
Peace Pagodas, known as Shanti Stupas, are Buddhist monuments built to inspire peace. A place for individuals of every race and background, the stupas were ideated under the guidance of Japanese monk Nichidatsu Fujii who was heavily influenced by Mahatma Gandhis commitment to non-violence.
Built around the world especially in war devastated cities like Hiroshima, Munich and Nagasaki, the pagodas symbolise unity and togetherness. A lot of these great structures were built by locals with the help of other monks and nuns from the Nipponzan-Myohoji Buddhist Order, founded by Fujiii.
A popular tourist and dream destination, Darjeeling is noted for its tea industry and the riveting Kangchenjunga mountains. Witnessing an exemplary diverse mix of cultures with the hill stations history intertwined with that of Nepal, Sikkim, Bhutan and British India, it is also home to the first of Indias seven peace pagodas. The Darjeeling Vishwa Shanti Stupa was built under the guidance of Nichidatsu Fujii, who was good friends with the Father of the Nation, Mahatma Gandhi. On your visit, explore the lush green fauna of the city while remembering to hop on to the Darjeeling Himalayan Railway.

It is a place of serenity and reflection, and the surrounding gardens are a delight to explore. The Pagoda is a symbol of harmony and peace and will leave a lasting impression on any traveler. I would definitely recommend visiting the Japanese Peace Pagoda

name: Jithin Krishnan
review_text:
I had an opportunity to visit Japanese Peace Pagoda in Darjeeling and was absolutely captivated by the peaceful and serene atmosphere of the location. The monastery was nestled in the foothills of the Himalayas, and the views of the surrounding mountains were absolutely breathtaking.

As I entered the monastery grounds, I was immediately struck by the sense of calm and tranquility that seemed to pervade the air. The buildings were simple and unadorned, with a focus on functionality rather than aesthetics. The monks who lived and worked at the monastery were all dressed in traditional robes, and they moved about their tasks with a sense of purpose and devotion.

As I explored the monastery, I was struck by the sense of community and connection that seemed to pervade the air. The monks were all very welcoming and seemed to genuinely enjoy answering my questions about their way of life. I was also impressed by the sense of purpose and discipline that seemed to be a part of daily life at the monastery. The monks followed a strict schedule that included meditation, prayer, and study, and I could see how this structured way of life might be very conducive to spiritual growth.

Overall, my visit to the Buddhist monastery in Darjeeling was a truly enriching and memorable experience. The natural beauty of the location, combined with the peaceful and serene atmosphere of the monastery, made for a truly one-of-a-kind experience. If you have the opportunity to visit a Buddhist monastery, I highly recommend it - you will not be disappointed.

name: Abhishek Shukla
review_text:
A place for folks thriving for inner peace. Most peaceful place of Darjeeling. The one place that inspires you to meditate and introspect. Such a well maintained place. Do visit the pagoda in early morning hours in order to feel its sanctity and peace. The breathtaking views of Kanchenjunga are another bonus. A very calm and serene atmosphere embrace you and leaves you so full of the ambience of the place.

Peace Pagoda, Darjeeling or Darjeeling Peace Pagoda is one of the Peace Pagodas designed to provide a focus for people of all races and creeds to help unite them in their search for world peace. It is located in the town of Darjeeling in the Indian state of West Bengal. Like most of the other Peace Pagodas, it was built under the guidance of Nichidatsu Fujii (1885-1985), a Buddhist monk from Japan and founder of the Nipponzan-Myohoji Buddhist Order.

name: Rupesh Donkalwar
review_text:
Queen of the Himalayas
Darjeeling Tourism

The former summer capital of India during the British rule, Darjeeling is one of the most sought-after hill stations in India. Located in West Bengal, this scenic hill station is the perfect getaway for a romantic honeymoon. Nestled in acres of tea plantations, Darjeeling is at an altitude of 2,050 meters above sea level, thus boasting a cool climate throughout the year.

Established in 1881, the toy train is a UNESCO World Heritage Site. The train starts its journey from the plains and climbs to a height of over 2000 meters above sea level, offering breathtaking views of the mountains along the way.

More than 86 tea plantations in Darjeeling are responsible for producing the world famous Darjeeling Tea. Have a cup of locally brewed chai at a tea plantation or go down to a plantation and pick some tea leaves yourself; You are free to make your choice!

Kanchenjunga peak, the third highest peak in the world and the highest peak in India is visible from here and you can enjoy the panoramic view of the peak. Some of Darjeelings popular attractions include monasteries, botanical gardens, a zoo, and the Darjeeling-colored Valley Passenger Ropeway Cable Car, the longest Asian cable car. Tiger Hill is a fantastic place to watch the sunrise over the mountains in all its vivid glory.

name: Pramit Pratim Ghosh
review_text: Just a few metres away from the Japanese Buddhist Temple stands the Peace Pagoda, this too set up by Fujii Guruji, a proponent of a Buddhist order dedicated to world peace. Apparently he was someone who saw the disaster caused by the Atom Bombs of 1945 from close quarters and was a close associate of Gandhiji as per the inscription you will find at the base of the Pagoda. Situated at a height, the Pagoda also offers a panaromic view of Darjeeling as well as the Kanchenjunga mountain range on a clear day. Dont miss the 4 avatars of Buddha which are carved on to the Pagoda!

name: Arun Singla
review_text:
Peace Pagoda, Darjeeling, West Bengal India

This Buddhist stupa is located in the Jalpahad hill area at a distance of about 2.5 km from Darjeeling city. The height of the pagoda is 94 feet.

Peace Pagoda is one of the most popular attractions of Darjeeling city. It shows the four incarnations of Lord Mercury. Here there are very beautiful golden colored statues of Lord Mercury, in which Buddhas postures like sitting, sleeping, standing and meditating are shown.

Here you will have to walk on foot for about 1 km, which first goes down and then up, and you will also have to climb some stairs. When you reach the top tired, it is fun to see the bench in front, but here it is written "Don't sit here".

After reaching the stupa, you will see the Japanese temple below you and rows of pine trees all around, a wonderful view of snow covered mountains is visible in the background.
From here you also get to see beautiful and picturesque views of Kanchenjunga mountains and Darjeeling.

The purpose of establishing the Buddhist Stupa was to provide a platform to all those people who were engaged in the search for peace in the world.

Its opening time is from 4:30 am to 7:00 pm.
There is no entry fee.
Public facilities are available here...

Peace Pagoda, Darjeeling or Darjeeling Peace Pagoda is one of the Peace Pagodas designed to provide a focus for people of all races and creeds to help unite them in their search for world peace. It is located in the town of Darjeeling ,West Bengal. This Peace Pagoda is a Buddhist stupa; a monument to inspire peace, designed to provide a focus for people of all races and creeds, and to help unite them in their search for world peace

The complex also has Japanese Temple where it is said that prayers are recited 24 x 7.

name: Indradeep Roy
review_text:
There are 2 structures in the same premises. The one I am writing about in this review is the white structure that is called the Peace Pagoda. Parking is available at the gate of the Japanese temple and the rest has to be walked. The trek is easy. There are no entry charges to visit here.

The white colour of the Pagoda in the midst of greenery on the Jalapahar hills is a sight to behold. I visited on a day after heavy snowfall and thus had to slowly move on slippery ice making it very difficult to navigate up the structure.

It was built under the guidance of Nichidatsu Fujii , a Buddhist monk from Japan and founder of the Nipponzan-Myohoji Buddhist Order. The foundation stone was laid in 1972 and was inaugurated in 1992.

It houses the four avatars of Buddha including Maitreya Buddha. The height of the pagoda is 94 ft and diameter is 23 metres

name: Shampa Guha
review_text: Its excellent place for tourists. This Peace Pagoda is a Buddhist Stupa. This Pagoda is situated on the Slopes of the Jalpahar Hill , in the town of Darjeeling. Its open hours is from 4.30am in the morning up to 7pm daily. There is no admission fee. Prayers timings are from 4.30am to 6am, and 4.30pm to 6.30pm.

Its one of most visited place by the tourists and locals. It is really peaceful where you can spend your quality time friends and family. It has different avatars and positions of Buddha! And people can see different type Buddhas teachings written and explain in the wall of Peace Pagoda.

This peace Pagoda is constructed to spread the world peace. Nearby this place just before reaching the place, we also can visit Japanese Temple.

They dont charge any entrance fee. Its free of cost. To access this place either you can go by walking or you can hire taxi from Capital Hall stand- just below the planters Hospital , Kunga, Kaventers.

Happy visiting.

name: rohit velapure
review_text:
The beautiful Buddhist monastery and Peace Pagoda is located near the top of the Jalapahar Hill, about 2 km from the Darjeeling Clock Tower.
We are lucky that it was open while our stay in Darjeeling in first week of October.
The pagoda had beautiful gold plated sculptures of the Buddha in various postures and murals depicting some of the events in his life.

Mesmerizing view, serene peace and awesome place with tall pine trees and rhododendron bushes just beginning to flower, and with the majestic Kanchenjunga mountains as the backdrop. A must visit place in Darjeeling.

What really enhances this place, and adds joy, is in the upper prayer hall of the nearby temple building. If you are lucky your visit will coincide with the chanting of prayers, and drumming.

review_text: Nice cool calm place. Some tourists not living up to the standard and make this peace pagoda totally unacceptable. Very good place fir relaxation and scenic beauty.

name: Jayanth Bj
review_text:
One of the best places to visit in and around Darjeeling. The view from the peace Pagoda beats any other spot, except tiger hills. A clear view of the kanchenjunga, the range, as well as darjeeling, surrounding on all sides by tall pines and trees. The Foothills and foggy tea gardens on the other side adds to the scenic beauty.
As for the Pagoda itself, it is very calm and peaceful, and if you go around midday youll enjoy the warm sun too. It has inscriptions of Gautama Buddhas life all around. There is a Japanese temple at the entrance as well.
I would personally recommend you to take a walk to the Pagoda, it takes around 30-40 minutes from Mall Road. The onward journey is mostly uphill but not too tiring. Loads of small shacks and shops for snack and water breaks. The view of the hills and mountains also gets increasingly better to be enjoyed by walk.

name: Kundan Sagar
review_text:
Sukoon.... The most expensive thing now a days.....

This dazzling, white hillside pagoda is one of many built by the Japanese Buddhist organization Nipponzan Myohoji as a symbol of peace and tranquility. Showcasing the four avatars of Lord Buddha, the site offers stunning views of Darjeeling and the Himalayan ranges encompassing it.Situated on the slopes of the Jalapahar Hill, Peace Pagoda is a symbol of peace and unity in Darjeeling. The pagoda is counted among the popular landmarks of the destination.Inside the pagoda, there are four iridescent, gold-polished statues of Lord Buddha. The walls are adorned with eight sandstone carvings that depict stories of various stages of Gautama Buddha's life. The divinity of the place is elevated by the chanting of the mantra. Remember, it lies perched on the hillside at the end of AJC Bose road, and one way route is instructed by police. Peace Pagoda is also known as Vishwa Shanti Stupa is a Buddhists monument to inspire peace to all races and creeds. Vishwa Shanti Stupas has been created across the world in search for world peace by a Buddhist monk. There are 7 Peace Pagoda and this one is dedicated to WORLD PEACE. Ample space for parking are here..
Hills, Nature, cloud and surrounding, Feel the divinity here, purify you soul.

name: BABU O VARGHESE
review_text:
This is one of the most serene places to visit in Darjeeling.
The peace pagoda (Shanti Stupa) is a Buddhist monument to help people of all religions and creed to unite them for the purpose of world peace. Many of these were built post world war -II under the guidance of the Japanese Buddhist Monk Nichitastu Fujiii who was greatly inspired by Mahatma Gandhi. There are almost eighty such peace pagodas built around the world. And construction of this peace pagoda at Darjeeling was started in 1972 and was dedicated in 1992. On the walls of this pagoda, the important phases of Lord Buddha's life is shown in the wooden carvings and images.

review_text: Peace Pagoda was inaugurated in 1992. Located at about 10 minutes distance by car from Darjeeling central mall area. The pagoda has a scenic location on the slopes of Jalpahar hills. The surroundings are lush green and the premises have some floral landscaping. This is a popular tourist spot in Darjeeling showcasing classic Japanese style architecture.

name: Aishwarya Dey
review_text: Beautiful white pagoda looks amazing.... Its constructed on the slopes of Jalapahar hills on the guidance of Buddhist monk. It is the tallest free standing structure in Darjeeling. There is two temple.... One Peace Pagoda & another Japanese Temple.... One have to step lots of stairs to reach the top of Pagada & from there the view of Darjeeling is wonderful. In the top of the pagoda there is four avatars of Lord Buddha..... Sitting Buddha, Sleeping Buddha, Standing Buddha & Meditating Buddha. In White Pagoda, Golden Lord Buddha avatars looks Superb. In Japanese Temple on few steps below the pagoda one can meditate. The place symbolize.... Peace & Harmony. Must Visit

name: Aldrin Sangma
review_text: Darjeeling is the worst place to visit. Place is very beautiful but people involve in dealing with tourist are the worst people on planet. When we visited Peace Pagoda one cab driver told us very badly that we are ruining their business because we took our own vehicle and we should have hire tourist cab. We were from Meghalaya and so was our vehicle registered in ML. He saw that and targeted us. One lady at Tiger Hill view point was forcing my friend to buy coffee from her, when he refused to buy She call him kaanjoose. Dont ever visit Darjeeling. I am hoping to meet that cab driver outside Darjeeling one day.

name: Joseph Sundaram
review_text:
Japanese Temple & Peace Pagoda Also known as Nipponzan Myohoji Buddhist Temple, the shrine was built in 1972 and is located 10 minutes away from the Darjeeling town centre, on the hill of Jalapahar. Showcasing classic Japanese style of architecture, this resplendent white building offers visitors a serene and quiet sanctum where they can meditate and seek inner peace.
It houses the four avatars of Buddha including Maitreya Buddha. The Pagoda is situated on the slopes of the Jalapahar hills of Darjeeling.

name: Umesh Rao
review_text:
A very beautiful and serene place I visited the pagoda during my visit to Darjeeling in February 2021.

The best time to visit it is in the morning by about 8.00 AM when there are few people around. Infact when we visited the pagoda we were the only visitors apart from a couple of sweepers who were cleaning the place quite vigorously.

The entire atmosphere was very peaceful and the surrounding greenery gave an ethereal look to the Pagoda. We prayed and went around the Pagoda a couple of times and left feeling very calm and invigorated

name: Vishal Kumar
review_text: Peace pagoda... Another very beautiful tourist place of Darjeeling and as per the name, there is a lot of peace here. This place is dedicated to Lord Buddha where people of all religions can come to visit. Along with this, there is also a Japanese temple whose interior will surprise you. This pagoda shows the biography of Lord Buddha in which his life from birth to death has been depicted on a piece of wood. To reach here you will have to book a car. This pagoda is built on top of the hill from where you can see almost the entire Darjeeling.

name: Dr J C Pandit
review_text: Darjeeling Peace Pagoda is situated on the slopes of the Jalapahar hills of Darjeeling, a few kilometers from Darjeeling town. The Peace Pagoda showcases the four avatars of Lord Buddha. It is a revered place that is believed to be a symbol of spirituality and peace. It is a magnificent white monument. The view of Darjeeling landscape from the Pagoda is captivating. Its must visit place.

name: Saily Kamle
review_text:
*The Japanese Peace Pagoda*

Peace Pagoda located in the town of Darjeeling in the Indian state of West Bengal is one of the peace pagodas designed to provide a focus for people of all races & creeds to help unite them in their search for world peace.

It was built by a Buddhist monk Fuiji to spread a message of harmony all around the world after the bombings in Hiroshima and Nagasaki.

It is situated on the slopes of Jalaphar Hill and showcases the four avatars of Buddha, including the Maitreya Buddha.

Timings- 9 am to 6 pm

It is effortlessly accessible by road. You can either drive through in your own car or rent a taxi as it is just 10 minutes away from the Darjeeling town centre.

name: Anu
review_text:
This place is a must to visit in Darjeeling.
Once you reach at the top of the Pagoda, you will be fascinated and dazed by the views it offers. You will see greenery all around you. You may get an opportunity to see the snow laden white mountains on a clear day.
Built by a Buddhist monk Fuiji, the Japanese Peace Pagoda of Darjeeling spreads a message of harmony all around the world after the bombings in Hiroshima and Nagasaki. The foundation stone of this place was laid in the year 1972 by Fuiji and was completed by his favourite disciple Guruji Fuiji in the year 1992. This place welcomes individuals from all over the world, regardless of any religion and expresses a message of religious equality and harmony. A visit to this beautiful place will surely give you immense peace and a sense of positivity.
It is built in a traditional Japanese style. The amazing architecture of the temple will completely leave you captivated. Tourists can also attend prayers held at this temple.
A visit to this beautiful place will surely give you immense level of mental relaxation.
